# Julie Hendry

> Interim and fractional CIO. FBCS. Treasurer, BCS Ethics Committee. MSc Psychology. Thirty years of technology transformation at scale across government, financial services, life sciences, and media.

## About

Julie Hendry is a technology executive with over thirty years of experience in technology transformation. She is a Fellow of the British Computer Society (FBCS), Treasurer of the BCS Ethics Committee, and holds an MSc in Psychology (Distinction) from the University of Strathclyde and a BSc in Computer Studies from Glasgow Caledonian University. She was a Visiting Researcher at the University of Strathclyde (2020-21). She has completed executive programmes at Columbia (Data Science for Executives) and the Linux Foundation (Quantum Computing).

She takes on interim and fractional CIO positions, taking full ownership of technology estates with direct board accountability. Her approach starts with people and organisational diagnosis before prescribing solutions.

## Experience

- VP Engineering, Abcam (AIM-listed life sciences company, £260M revenue): delivery, engineering, and operations across UK, China, US, and EU. Created the business's first unified technology portfolio. Integrated with Oracle Cloud ERP. AWS migration reducing operating costs by 40%. Unlocked double-digit growth after four consecutive years stalled entering a fifth.
- Group Director of Software Delivery, Travis Perkins (FTSE 250, £4.9B revenue): unified all group brands under a single software delivery function for the first time. Led evacuation of 100 team members during Ukraine conflict while maintaining delivery continuity.
- CEO, Cybersafe Schools: evolved from compliance-focused Risk Protection Arrangement to comprehensive SaaS platform incorporating NCSC tools.
- Director of Delivery, Cognizant (Fortune 500): Director of Delivery within the Microsoft Business Group.
- GDS, Cabinet Office: coached the Exemplar programme teams delivering the Digital by Default strategy, including the team that replaced paper driving licence counterparts for 40 million licence holders. Authored "Governance principles for agile service delivery," adopted across UK government. Trained and coached over 200 civil servants.
- ESFA: led 150-person cross-supplier team delivering the digital Apprenticeship Service, managing the distribution of £2.7 billion in annual levy funds.
- HMRC: agile delivery and dev tooling within the Aspire programme.
- Earlier career across JP Morgan, Sungard, American Express, BBC, Barclays, Tesco, Sky, The Guardian, Royal London, and Ordnance Survey.

## Research

CTO and co-founder of beò (beo.llc). Her MSc research (Hendry, 2020, n=82) found near-zero correlation between standard technology questionnaires and actual usage behaviour. beò builds on this evidence base.
